climbs.name: Yosemite Sam and the Stiff Pins
climbs.fa: Evan Deis, Kevin Vanharn, Cassandra Miertschin, Ella Walker, Joel Irby.  10.31.2015

content.description: The route ascends the Northeast side of the tower beginning with a steep wide section (crux) which leads into discontinuous and loose terrain and eventually to a shelf.  Stem the remaining 30 meters up a chimney on dispersed but good pro.
content.protection: Two sets of friends 0.75-6.  Larger gear for the beginning if you have it.

climbs.name: Talking Bull
climbs.fa: FBI (Fat Bastards International) Climbing Team - Cam, Charlie French (UK), Mark Van Dome (UK), Jumar Joe Coll (UK) March 1, 1998

content.description: As Described in DRIII (Bjornstad).  Approximately 150 feet (46 m) left of the base of the tower is a gully (5.7) that leads to the mesa top.  There are 2 bolts (for the descent) at the top of the gully.  Walk along the mesa top to a 15-foot gap separating the mesa from Indian Chief.  Downclimb into the notch, then to the summit of the spire.
content.location:
As Described in DRIII (Bjornstad). Talking Bull is accessed by hiking the drainage left (north) of the tower, then back right (west) along a bench 100 feet (30 m) below the mesa top.

Reverse the Mesa walk and rap the steep gully.
